meaningMnemonic:
Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>beckon</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to beckon</vocabulary>. 

Since 招く conjures up the image of someone beckoning, it also means <vocabulary>to invite</vocabulary>, and is a relatively formal word. Figuratively, it can also mean <vocabulary>to cause</vocabulary>, as in inviting some undesirable outcome or situation.
